title: Analogy-Based Information Retrieval Strategies for Mathematical Problem Solving

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Aims to enhance mathematical information retrieval skills in a smartphone-based, limited-technology environment, applying analogical teaching methods that connect real-life cases with mathematical concepts.

learning_goals: Learners can explain how to connect real-life problems encountered during math research tasks with core concepts (e.g., keywords, operators) necessary for information retrieval.
Learners can identify and prioritize at least three information sources for solving complex math problems using analogical reasoning.
Learners can achieve over 80% accuracy by applying analogical thinking when selecting credible, topic-related resources.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
